title: Papers: Leicester join PL battle for Cantwell
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Monday's national newspapers...

title: Cavani has committed to Man Utd stay, says Rangnick
shortDescription: Ralf Rangnick has hailed Edinson Cavani as "the perfect role model" after revealing the Uruguayan has pledged his future to Manchester United for the rest of the season.

title: Mourinho blasts 'weak' Roma after Juventus loss
shortDescription: Jose Mourinho did not hold back in criticising his Roma team after they blew a 3-1 lead to lose to Juventus, accusing players of being "weak" and "lacking personality".

title: AFCON: Cape Verde edge past 10-man Ethiopia
shortDescription: Julio Tavares headed the winner as Cape Verde beat 10-man Ethiopia 1-0 on the opening day of the Africa Cup of Nations on Sunday.

title: Monday at AFCON: Senegal, Ghana, Guinea make bows
shortDescription: Dates, kick-off times and host cities - here's the full schedule for AFCON 2021.

title: Arteta: Arsenal not good enough and must apologise
shortDescription: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal needed to apologise after a below-par performance led to a third-round FA Cup defeat to Nottingham Forest.

title: Forest floor abject Arsenal in third round again
shortDescription: Lewis Grabban's late strike stunned Arsenal as Nottingham Forest dumped the Gunners out of the FA Cup.

title: Leicester's trip to Everton postponed after PL grants Foxes' request
shortDescription: Leicester's game at Everton on Tuesday has been postponed after the Premier League granted the visitors' request to rearrange the fixture.

title: AFCON: Hosts Cameroon come from behind to win opener
shortDescription: Hosts Cameroon came from behind with two penalties in the space of eight minutes at the end of the first half to beat Burkina Faso 2-1 in the opening game of AFCON.

title: Euro round-up: Roma collapse; Zlatan matches Ronaldo
shortDescription: Zlatan Ibrahimovic matched a Cristiano Ronaldo record as depleted AC Milan won 3-0 at 10-man Venezia to move top of Serie A on Sunday.

title: Hits and misses: Point of no return for Ndombele?
shortDescription: The highs and lows as underdogs sprinkled stardust over a dramatic FA Cup weekend while Tanguy Ndombele's tantrum leaves his future in doubt at Tottenham.

title: Klopp eases Thiago fears - 'He's not out for season'
shortDescription: Jurgen Klopp has dismissed concerns Thiago Alcantara could be ruled out for the season after the Liverpool midfielder was absent for Sunday's FA Cup win over Shrewsbury.

title: Villa set to beat PL rivals to Digne signing
shortDescription: Aston Villa are in advanced negotiations to sign Lucas Digne from Everton, with the left-back understood to favour a move to Steven Gerrard's side.

title: Booed Ndombele urged to change fans' opinions by Conte
shortDescription: Antonio Conte suggested Tanguy Ndombele needs to improve on the pitch to get Tottenham fans back on side after he was loudly booed during the FA Cup win over Morecambe.

title: FA Cup: Cardiff beat Preston in extra-time | Luton & Stoke wins
shortDescription: Mark Harris fired an FA Cup extra-time winner as Cardiff beat Preston 2-1, with Luton and Stoke both seeing off lower league opposition to reach the fourth round.

title: FA Cup R4: Kidderminster host West Ham, Chelsea face Plymouth
shortDescription: Kidderminster have been handed an FA Cup fourth-round tie at home to West Ham, while Liverpool will host Cardiff and League One side Plymouth will travel to Chelsea.

title: Wolves sweep Sheffield United aside
shortDescription: Daniel Podence scored twice as Wolves breezed into the fourth round of the FA Cup with a 3-0 win over Sheffield United at Molineux.

title: Late Rashica strike sees Norwich edge past Charlton
shortDescription: Milot Rashica's late winner secured Norwich's place in the FA Cup fourth round as they beat Charlton 1-0 in a hard-fought third-round tie.

title: Tottenham avoid FA Cup scare with late Morecambe win
shortDescription: Tottenham needed three late goals to avoid an FA Cup upset against Morecambe, coming from behind to win 3-1 as Tanguy Ndombele was booed off by the home fans.

title: Gordon sets Liverpool on way to Shrewsbury win
shortDescription:
Seventeen-year-old Kaide Gordon became Liverpool's youngest FA Cup goalscorer
as he set Jurgen Klopp's side on the way to a 4-1 third-round victory vs Shrewsbury.
